props.name: width

props.name: padding
props.description: The amount of padding inside the content.

props.name: hidden
props.type: | boolean | { narrow?: boolean regular?: boolean wide?: boolean }
props.description: Whether the content is hidden.

props.name: aria-label
props.description: Label for the pane. Required if the pane overflows and doesn't have aria-labelledby.

props.name: aria-labelledby
props.description: Id of an element that acts as a label for the pane. Required if the pane overflows and doesn't have aria-label.

props.name: width
props.type: | 'small' | 'medium' | 'large' | { min: string max: string default: string }
props.description: The width of the pane. If using custom widths, provide an object with keys 'min', 'max' and 'default'.

props.name: minWidth
props.description: The minimum width of the pane.

props.name: resizable
props.description: When true, the pane may be resized by the user. Uses localStorage persistence by default. Note: with default persistence in SSR, the server-rendered width may differ from the stored client width, causing a brief layout shift on hydration. Use `onResizeEnd` with server-aware storage to avoid this.

props.name: currentWidth
props.description: Current/controlled width value in pixels. Required when `onResizeEnd` is provided. Pass `undefined` when the persisted value has not loaded yet. The `width` prop still defines the default used when resetting (e.g., double-click).

props.name: onResizeEnd
props.description: Callback fired when a resize operation ends (drag release or keyboard key up). When provided, replaces localStorage persistence. Requires `currentWidth`.

props.name: widthStorageKey
props.description: localStorage key used to persist the pane width across sessions. Only applies when `resizable` is `true` and no `onResizeEnd` callback is provided.

props.name: sticky
props.description: Whether the pane should stick to the top of the screen while the content scrolls.

props.name: offsetHeader
props.description: Use offsetHeader along with the sticky prop to push the sticky pane down to make room for a sticky header if necessary. Use the type `string` to specify the height with a unit i.e. 5rem; otherwise the type `number` will be taken as px.

props.name: padding
props.description: The amount of padding inside the pane.

props.name: hidden
props.type: | boolean | { narrow?: boolean regular?: boolean wide?: boolean }
props.description: Whether the pane is hidden.

props.name: position
props.description: Which side of the page the pane should be on. Can be changed for different viewport widths.

props.name: aria-label
props.description: A unique label for the sidebar region.

props.name: aria-labelledby
props.description: An id to an element which uniquely labels the sidebar region.

props.name: position
props.description: Position of the sidebar relative to the page layout. The sidebar spans the full height of the layout, adjacent to the header, content, and footer.

props.name: width
props.type: | 'small' | 'medium' | 'large' | { min: string max: string default: string }
props.description: The width of the sidebar. If using custom widths, provide an object with keys 'min', 'max' and 'default'.

props.name: minWidth
props.description: Minimum width of the sidebar when resizable.

props.name: resizable
props.description: When true, the sidebar may be resized by the user. Width is persisted to localStorage by default.

props.name: widthStorageKey
props.description: localStorage key used to persist the sidebar width across sessions. Only applies when resizable is true.

props.name: padding
props.description: The amount of padding inside the sidebar.

props.name: divider
props.description: Divider style between the sidebar and the rest of the layout.

props.name: sticky
props.description: Whether the sidebar sticks to the viewport when scrolling. When enabled, the sidebar uses position: sticky with top: 0 and height: 100vh.

props.name: responsiveVariant
props.description: Controls sidebar behavior at narrow viewport widths (below 768px). 'default' retains its normal inline layout. 'fullscreen' expands to cover the full viewport like a dialog overlay.

props.name: hidden
props.type: | boolean | { narrow?: boolean regular?: boolean wide?: boolean }
props.description: Whether the sidebar is hidden.
